questions.question_text: Which time range picker configuration would return real-time events for the past 30 seconds?

discussion.content:
C is correct
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/7.2.6/Search/Selecttimerangestoapply

Selected Answer: C
C. Real-time - Earliest: 30-seconds ago, Latest: Now 
Real-time time picker option is available in Splunk out-of.box.

Selected Answer: B
The option Real-time is no longer present in the Time Range picker, in this scenario the Relative time picker makes sense
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.3.2/Search/Selecttimerangestoapply

Not sure why people are saying C, since in the time picker there is no "real-time" option - just presets, relative, date range, date and time range, and advanced. The only option that works with "earliest" and "latest" options using "30-seconds ago" and "Now" values, respectively, is the relative option; so B.
C is the right answer
C. Real-time - Earliest: 30-seconds ago, Latest: Now

questions.question_text: What is the correct syntax to count the number of events containing a vendor_action field?

choices.C: It makes the dashboard more efficient because it only has to run one search string.
choices.D: Any change to the underlying report will affect every dashboard that utilizes that report.
choices.B: There are no benefits to creating dashboard panels from reports.
choices.A: Any newly created dashboard will include that report.

discussion.content: D is correct

"When using a panel from a report, you cannot modify the search string in the panel, but you can change and configure the visualization. If the report search changes, the panel using that report updates accordingly."

"D"

Selected Answer: D
" It makes the dashboard more efficient because it only has to run one search string." This might be true only if there is one panel in the Dashboard. It is rare a Dashboard has less than one panel, in my experience.

My vote is C.
What makes D a benefit? Frankly, C is the only benefit in the multiple choices.

comments.content: so it's not true to say " it only has to run one search string."
Dashboard can have multiple panels that can have multiple searches.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Both C and D are correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
D is correct
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D - The other three options are just flat out false.

Selected Answer: D
Any change to the underlying report will affect every dashboard that utilizes that report.
D is correct answer

Selected Answer: D
"When using a panel from a report, you cannot modify the search string in the panel, but you can change and configure the visualization. If the report search changes, the panel using that report updates accordingly."
D without question
Yes, D is the correct answer. Why it this commented more than 1 year ago and is C still the right answer? Should be fixed imho.

D is correct
pag 154 Any change to the underlying report affects every dashboard panel
that utilizes that report

comments.content: Page 154 Fun 1 PDF not 132. D is the correct answer.

discussion.content: Answer D - Page 132 Fun1 PDF. Why Create Dashboard panel - it is efficient to use 1 report across several dashboards and when the report changes any dashboard using it will change too.
Exam keywords here are likely "one benefit"; D seems to be a fact/constraint/given
D is correct

questions.question_text: What is one benefit of creating dashboard panels from reports?
By default, which of the following fields would be listed in the fields sidebar under interesting Fields?

discussion.content: B is correct

B - index (is the correct answer)
"By default, host, source, and sourcetype are displayed under Selected Fields"
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
host, source and sourcetype are listed under "Selected Fields" not "interesting fields".

Selected Answer: B
Index is the correct answer, try it out!!
index is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.0/SearchTutorial/Aboutthesearchapp

Selected Answer: B
index is not preselected that's why it's in interesting fields.

Selected Answer: B
Host, source, and sourcetype are in the selected field section by default. Which leaves index for the interesting fields section right below on the sidebar.

Selected Answer: B
host, source & sourcetype are displayed, by default, under Selected Fields
ANSWER IS B

host, source & sourcetype are displayed, by default, under Selected Fields, so these answers are incorrect.
Index is the correct answer, because it's the only one that is left and also because under Interesting Fields, all the fields are displayed that are present in at least 20% of the results. This would be the case for index, because all events are always part of an index.
So the correct answer is B
It is ACD slide 60 of Splunk Fundamentals 1
Instead of "Interesting Fields", it should say "Selected Fields"

comments.content: It would have been. if that is multiple questions. It is a trick question however. And thats is why A,C,D fields are Selected by default. Whereas Index is not and it is located in Interesting fields by default. Hence Correct answer is B

discussion.content: This question is confusing.nteresting fields are key-value pairs that Splunk extracts when searching the data. When you dispatch a search, Splunk will try to identify delimiters such as an equal sign or colon and assign the value on the left as the field and the value on the right as the value. It will then take these key-value pairs and list them under interesting fields if that fields is atleast 20% of the search range by default. You can pop open the fields at the bottom of the selection and select any fields that you want at the top and they become selected fields.https://community.splunk.com/t5/Archive/What-is-an-interesting-field/m-p/417956. I think the correct answer is A, C,D

SELECTED FIELDS
host 2
source 2
sourcetype 

Answer is B. Index doesn't fall under selected field.
index is correct answer

comments.content:
My mistake...didn't see the interesting Fields.
Answer is index. B.
Question says Whcih of the Following !

discussion.content:
Question says which (all) fields?
Answer is: host, source, sourcetype
A, C, D
Is the index Not host, B is correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about case sensitivity is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - Field names ARE case sensitive; field values are NOT (is the correct answer)
src_ip=" " is correct. SRC_IP= " " is wrong

Selected Answer: B
refer to https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/SplunkCloud/latest/SearchTutorial/Usefieldstosearch

B is correct
pag 84 Field names ARE case sensitive; field values are NOT

choices.C: Field values ARE case sensitive; field names ARE NOT.
choices.D: Both field names and field values ARE NOT case sensitive.
choices.B: Field names ARE case sensitive; field values are NOT.
choices.A: Both field names and field values ARE case sensitive.
